If you are looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Cookies recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients

1/2 cup butter, 

softened 1/2 cup peanut butter 

1 cup packed brown sugar 

1/2 cup white sugar 

2 eggs 

2 tablespoons light corn syrup 

2 tablespoons water 

2 teaspoons vanilla extract 

2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour 

1 teaspoon baking soda 

1/2 teaspoon salt 

2 cups chopped semisweet chocolate


Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
In a large bowl, cream together the butter, peanut butter, brown sugar, and white sugar until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the corn syrup, water, and vanilla. Combine the flour, baking soda, and salt; stir into the peanut butter mixture. Fold in chocolate chunks. Drop by 1/4 cupfuls 3 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 12 to 14 minutes in the preheated oven, or until edges are golden. Allow cookies to cool for 1 minute on the cookie sheet before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Um jogo clássico, bom, só que hoje em dia não tem muitos jogadores. Não sei se a compra vale a pena pois por mais que seja um jogo que é divertido, possui imitações por ser bem antigo, e a falta de jogadores faz com não tenha sentido a compra do mesmo. Ele se parece muito com o CS clássico pois foi feito encima da mesma engine: Gold Scr. Para mim é um bom jogo, mas que só valhe a compra por míseros reais ou com ele vindo em algum pacote.

Tal vez sea un poco arcaico para los tiempos que corren, pero Day of Defeat es uno de los mejores FPS multijugador que he jugado nunca. Es rápido, dinámico y está bien balanceado. En su día, los que jugábamos manteníamos que corregía todas las trabas de Counter-Strike y fue, con mucho, el juego más jugado del ciber al que solía ir. Pude profundizar en él, entrar en competición y hasta jugar para equipos de alto nivel e incluso la selección de mi país. Un juego repleto de recuerdos que toodavía sigo jugando hoy día, tras tantos años. Sólo puedo recomendarlo.
Klasse, atmosphärischer Retrotitel.

This game is a one of a kind classic, and i love it. The gameplay is good, with certain problems like i noticed theres sometimes a delay before you shoot. It can be hard, however it is very rarely frustrating. Thats only when you fight bots. The player base is small, and theres only a few servers with real people on it. The graphics arnt hd, but there not sloppy either. i got game this purely based on its looks, and i feel like its almost a masterpiece of art as far as early FPS games are. Theres just somthing great about this DoD game, and i would highly reccomend it to others.

This is one of the best shooters I have played in a long time, and a contender for my favourite game of all time. 
I really like the WW2 setting, which is always a draw, the maps are great and there are countless maps available online, and the graphics, although outdated, have that charm that all GoldSource games seem to have. It isn't dead, I thought it would be, but it wasn't and there are still many many servers to choose. I would advise [FULL METAL JACKET]  for a server to play on with a range of maps and there are always players playing. 
For the price of three pounds ninety-nine pence, no that isn't American currency - I can't be arsed - it is a great shooter and more than worth every penny.
Also, like me, if your internet isn't very good, download "Sturmbot" for free, where you can play on virtually any map with really intelligent bots offline, probably the best bots/AI player mod for any game I've ever played. This also enables you to play on a full sever even just on your own or with a small group of friends - it's great.

This game was probably pretty good back in the day (it did warrant a sequel after all). That being said, I just can't get into it. The movement system is odd, with unclear pauses inbetween actions and a borderline pointless stamina bar. The guns themselves are fairly well done, although I found myself disliking the weapons for an entire nation (America), meaning I would be stuck with weapons I didn't want half the time, since the Brits are playable on comparatively few maps and you can't always be on Axis. Finding a decent server was also a pain, unlike it's peer CS 1.6, Day of Defeat has not really retained enough popularity beyond a small dedicated community. I'd recommend looking elsewhere if you want a classic WW2 shooter.
